inn1.comm: back of a length and in the off-stump channel, Tamim taps it into the covers
he had been a consistent threat in the Tests and this ball was the reason. It was pitched just short of a good length and slanted away from the left-hander. Good decision from Tamim not to play
short and offering enough room for Tamim to flay through point - right through the fielder in fact
he ventures forward and allows a shortish delivery through to the keeper outside off
gets his length fuller on off stump and Anamul presses forward again to block into the covers
back of a length on off stump, Anamul has no trouble getting behind it
pushes Tamim back in his crease but the batsman presents a straight bat
tucks him up on his hips and Tamim has to push his front leg across on off stump to try and whip it away behind square and is a little slow on the shot
good length ball on off stump, Tamim is early into the shot this time and has to pull his bottom hand off
gets up on his tippy-toes to blunt a shortish ball on off stump down by his feet
drags the batsman forward with a good length ball a shade outside off, but Tamim keeps his bat and pad together

banged in short, the only problem was it had a lot of width too. Tamim is happy to hoist it over the infield and point and the ball screams away to the boundary. Typical Tamim flair as he nearly lifted himself off his feet as he played that
back of a length and outside off, Anamul is quite content not to chase after it
excellent line from Panyangara again as he probes around the fourth-fifth stump. Anamul refrains from playing
that's beautifully done. His patience outside off had forced the bowler off his line and once the length ball strayed on middle and leg, Anamul is able to tuck it between mid-on and midwicket
there's some swing, and that happens because Panyangara pitched the ball up and lured a lazy drive from Tamim. His front foot hadn't moved far enough across for it and he is lucky to be beaten
just back of a good length and cramping him on the stumps, defended
"No," yells Tamim as plods forward to block a good length ball towards mid-off
banged in and lifting outside off, Anamul has shown he will not poke at those
even with the ball fuller Anamul is adamant not to push outside off stump
this time he loses all sense of his restraints and runs blindly at the bowler. Chatara picked him out early, bowled shorter and beat his hoick
back of a length on middle and off, defended with soft hands and an open face
stays put in his crease as he spots a short ball angled in at him and works it behind square leg
back of a length and outside off, shoulders arms again
a little shortish on off stump, Tamim though is happy to edge forward and block
pushes a short of a length delivery on off stump back down to mid-off

chopped on! Tamim decided to cut a ball that barely had width and Zimbabwe benefit from his mistake. It was only mildly short, and he might have pulled some of the pace off it as well. The angled face came down as he hoped to sneak a few runs to third man. Ends up demolishing his stumps
slants this good length ball outside off, Mominul hoists his bat high over his head
whipped away into the midwicket region
a pretty drive into the covers as this is fuller and pushed a shade outside off
that's a beaut! It's a good length ball that lures Anamul forward and then straightens off the deck. Chatara's natural angle into the batsman enabled that delivery as well
good length ball on off stump, pushed into the coveres
jags this good back of a length delivery into the right-hander who is quite tentative. He has lead feet, and his hands are leading away from the body. The inside edge thuds into the thighs
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
punched back down the ground to mid-on as Chatara goes full and seeks the base of off stump

sublime timing as he slices it away behind point. It was the scrambled seam delivery, hoping that it might misbehave off this flat deck. Just sits up for Mominul to push forward and caress it behind square
good length ball outside off, not bothered with
length on middle and leg, Mominul tries to whip it away between midwicket and mid-on, but his timing on this occasion is not quite as good

top work from gully! The ploy of teasing him outside off is not quite working as Mominul displays considerable authority outisde his off stump. Hami M was the man diving away to his right to stop a front-foot slash
back of a length on off stump, Mominul though presses forward and blocks, while rising with the ball
runs down the track to try and split the heavily guarded off-side ring, but Panyangara veers the good length ball wide of his reach
BANG! He had attempted a similar shot a while back, but had ran at the bowler too early. This time he has timed his charge perfectly and has swatted a length delivery into the long-on boundary
that's a slower ball gone a touch awry as he lobs up a full toss on off stump, defended
back of a length and angled in towards off stump, Anamul was hoping to nudge it behind square on the off side and look for a quick single. No such luck
gets up off his toes to adjust to the bounce on a short delivery outside off and block it by his feet. No single there either

"catch," was the call and short fine leg did his best, nipping to his left and diving full-length. He got bot hands to it, but it just doesn't stick. John Nymbu was the man. Very touch chance as Anamul tried to help a shortish delivery away with the angle into him to the boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended
nudges a good length ball off his pads to deep square leg. A rare single for Anamul?
full and slanted into the left-hander as he goes around the wicket, Mominul uses his wrists to find mid-on
length on off stump, but the angle helps Mominul to swipe it away to deep midwicket. Came off the bottom of the blade though
good length ball on off stump, pushed down to mid-off
brings his wrists into play as a length ball on middle allows him to manouevre through midwicket
worked away off his pads, Zimbabwe are offering a few more escape routes recently and Mominul gets off at the square leg exit

that's brilliantly done, also showcases the true nature of this pitch. It was a length ball on off stump and Mominul is happy to whip it away across the line and makes enough contact for the ball to almost scurry away to the square leg boundary
and almost on cue, he offers a short ball outside off that Mominul is able to slap it behind point. Third man in the deep pulls out a dive and saves a boundary
full on off stump, Anamul pushes to mid-off. Not quite soft enough though for a single
just back of a good length on off stump, taken care off by a dead bat

runs at the bowler and has given his wicket away! He was making room for himself and succeeded a little too well. Chatara had pulled his length back as well and the smear over the covers ends up becoming a slice that goes straight up in the air, The Zimbabwe captain comes in from mid-off and takes it quite well because there were a few contenders vying for that catch
back of a length on middle and leg, Mominul tucks it away through to the sweeper on the leg side
fuller outside off and left alone
length ball on off stump and Mominul flicks to the wide off mid-on fielder for a a quick single
much slower this time, outside off and smothers to mid-off
drags it back a bit around off stump and dabs it back to the bowler
oho kept a shade low and fends a full ball to on side
solid in defence, gets a big stride in for a length ball and pushes in  front of cover
gets too straight, down the leg and he gets a fine tickle around the corner for a single
nice line again on of stump and punched to cover
touch fuller on off stump and tucks one to short mid-wicket
rash shot..! Length ball on off stump and shapes away to fox his cut
short, in fact way too short down the leg and called wide
gone.! Another false shot has bought his downfall. It was a length ball outside off, Mahmudullah on the front foot tried to clobber it over mid-on but finds Kamungozi
pulls straight away, back of a length delivery on off stump and Shakib pulls it awkwardly towards backward square for a single
on the pads and easily maneuvered to on side for a single
fuller on off stump and flicks to, straight to mid-on
no timing whatsoever, fuller on off stump and taps to mid-on
length ball on off stump, stood tall and punched to sweeper at cover
back of a length ball on off stump, gets a on to the front foot and pulls towards backward square leg for a couple
probing line on off stump and leaves it alone
wide this time around, pushed it wide outside off and and he chases after this one, play and a miss
back of a length ball on off stump and pulls to on side for a single and retains the strike
loads of wristwork to send this fuller ball from off stump to deep midwicket. Might have been risky elsewhere, but Chittagong has offered no laternal movement to worry the batsman
back of a length and outside off, Shakib chops it with soft hands through point
advances down the track but is unable to drill a fuller ball, despite getting to it on the half-volley, past mid-off

brilliant work all around, except from the bowler who pitched this short and wide. Mominul slashes it and keeps it down too. Poing had a lot of work to do as the ball came screaming to him, but he pulls out a  dive to the right and saves a boundary
cramps him up on off stump this time, even if the length was short. Mominul is able to steer it to point
another shortish ball on off stump, swiped away to deep midwicket. Didn't quite time that either
goes for a cut, but the angled face comes down under the ball and Mominul is beaten
good length ball on middle and leg, Mominul works it away to the left of mid-on to enable a well-judged single
had set up for the cut shot, but Shakib realises the length wasn't short enough and angle from around the wicket was limiting his room. Checks his shot and runs it to point
ample room on that occasion and Shakib has hammered it to deep point

gorgeous drive from Mominul as he leans as he drags himself forward as far as he could. Might have toppled over his own head if he had stretched more than that. Keeps his balance and hits on the up and through the covers
goes short and slides it on the hips of Shakib who helps it away to deep fine leg and that will be drinks
beats him! Shakib was stuck on his back foot, looking for the guide through point or third man. But Mire does not provide the requisite width and cuts him in half

edged, but it is thick enough to evade gully by a long way. It was a good ball slanted across the left-hander and third man should have had it covered, but a bit of sloppy work gives away a fortunate boundary.
oopsy! Full and outside off, only it was about six feet outside of it! Easy call for the ump
back of a length on off stump, Shakib works it into the vacant midwicket region to raise the Bangladesh fifty

oh, that was deft. Perhaps a little too much, maybe. It was a fuller delivery pushed across him and Mominul came forward with an open face and manages to evade the keeper's dive to his left. Only barely though and gets the ball quite fine to the third man boundary
good length ball on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Offcutter from Mire
slogs a length ball on middle away to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off as Chiggy continues around the wicket. Mominul plays the angle and clips it through midwicket

that was risky! Short cover thrust himself to his left to try and get behind a drive that Shakib hit on the up. It was a slower ball from Chiggy and the pitch helped it out as well to make sure the ball stopped on the batsman and force him to mistime it
fuller and a shade outside off, Mominul goes for an ugly across the line swipe and misses. Poor choice of stroke
full and slanted in on the pads, Mominul turns it away through midwicket

walks forward and across at the bowler, who takes offence and digs a short ball down on off stump. Shakib isn't worried though as he pulls down and to deep fine leg. Not enough pace for Chiggy to pose a threat with that length
backs away and cuts a shortish ball from off stump through the covers
stays back to run a good length ball, with the turn, through the covers
wanders down the track, but Nyumbu had spotted him and flattened his length. Shakib has to adjust and chop it past the keeper off the inside edge
lunges forward and sweeps a flighted delivery on middle to deep square leg
whips a length ball from off stump to the right of midwicket. No single there though
keeps back and punches a length ball down to long-on and get the single he wanted
runs at the bowler and whips a length ball that was angled into him to deep square leg. As much as Chiggy is cramping the batsman for room, this around-the-wicket line isn't troubling them much

okay, I know nothing about cricket. Chiggy stays around the wicket and delivers a beauty that has Mominul pushing away from his body. The ball was full and straightened enough to bring the batsman forward and leave him groping
fuller and a little too wide on this occasion as Mominul drives through to deep cover
banged in short and Mominul has pulled it to deep midwicket
short and wide, Shakib had loaded up for the cut but as well as he had hit it, Vusi Sibanda, I think, at point dives to his right and snaps up a lovely save.
so Shakib opens the face a little more and beats both points in place and retains the strike with a single to third man
a little short, a lot wide and Shakib has to reach for it off his back foot. The cut just about makes contact with the ball and goes into the covers
shortish and outside off, sliced away behind point
tossed up on middle and leg and keeps Mominul quiet

where was the need to play a shot like that? Runs away outside off to try and scoop over fine leg. The length was too full for him to get under, It was too close to off stump and he had left it quite open. Nyumbu says thank you very much and does a little jig
"Good, Johnny. Good, Johnny" says the keeper as he presents a good length ball on off stump and makes Mushy block
a little turn this time from outside off, but Mushy is able to blunt it off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers
shortish on middle and leg, turned away to the left of mid-on
fuller delivery outside off as Mushy gets himself forward to drive through the covers, but he is too early on the shot.
just like that as this is too full on middle and Mushy whips it away to deep midwicket
leans forward to tuck a flighted ball from outside off to midwicket
drags a loopy delivery from well outside off and sweeps to short midwicket
slower through the air as he tosses it up on off stump, Mushy works it around the corner for a single to fine leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed with the straight face to mid-off
rocks back and cracks a flatter delivery with just enough width through the covers. Lovely work to find the gap to the right of the man inside the circle

huge shout from Nyumbu for leg-before as Mushy planted his front leg across and was trying to work a good length ball around it. There was turn, but it might just have struck him outside the line of off stump
full on off stump, Shakib looks to hit it a little too hard and finds mid-off
full and wide outside off, called as much as the batsman doesn't bother with it
full on off stump, Shakib was looking for a booming drive down the ground but his timing deserts him. As does the bottom hand from the bat
tucks a length ball away to deep backward square leg and picks up a single. Then there is an overthrow as well to allow a second run. Terrible work
follows it up with a short ball and Shakib is quite happy to pull it through square leg. The man on the boundary rushes across to his left and dives full length to keep it to two. It was Kamungozi
full and slanted a little too far across Shakib, says the umpire
full and outside off, drilled to mid-off
swatted away to mid-on as he keeps to his crease against a shortish ball on off stump
flighted on middle, Mushy looks to tickle it fine but the man at 45 degrees intervenes
launches a slog sweep that falls short of the man at deep midwicket. He had to take the ball, which was flighted outside off, and drag it away.
goes back to a flatter ball on middle and slices it to point
ventures down the track and whips a length ball off his toes to long-on
stays back to a length ball that rips and turns from middle and goes down leg
tossed up outside off and he drills it through the covers. Ensured he had enough room to bring down that angled face and power it away
short and wide, Shakib has hammered that to the cover boundary despite the best efforts of Brendan Taylor patrolling that region. Bad ball, duly punished
tickled away to deep fine leg as he starts with a length ball on the stumps

length on off stump, Shakib has sized it up and launched it to the midwicket fence. Too slow for that length and the batsman is able to stay low enough to pummel it to the right of the man in the deep
full and on the legs, Shakib pushes down to long-on as the crowd roars his name
short and wide outside off, Mushy is able to steer it away to deep point
whipped away through midwicket against a length ball on middle
keeps to his crease and punches a short of a length ball into the covers
races down the track to reach the pitch of a flighted ball on off stump and smoke it down to mid-on. Chatara dives to his right and makes sure it is only a single
strays down leg again and the turn he is getting doesn't help this time
that was glorious! Nimble footwork gets him to the pitch of a flighted ball outside off and he unfurls a controlled cover drive that goes all the way to the boundary
this time the ball is on a length and Mushy looks to take advantage with a slog sweep. Had to reach a little too far for it outside off and that means he hits it long-on
stays back and works it off his pads to deep fine leg. Bangladesh have finally got the dance of interspersing boundaries with singles
short and asking to be pulled away, Mushy picks out deep square leg though
flighted on leg stump, worked away to mid-on

very optimistic shout for leg-before considering this flighted delivery was straying down leg. Pitched on leg and turning just enough to probably miss the stumps as Shakib misses a flick off the back foot
stays back to block a length ball on the stumps
quicker and flatter through the air as Shakib works it away through square leg
flighted on middle, presents a straight bat down on it and pushes it down the pitch
fires it in flat on leg stump, Mushy works it away behind square leg
ran down the track and pushes through the legs of the non-striker to retain strike
poor length from Nyumbu as he allows Shakib to rock back and cut through the covers. There is protection in the deep though
length ball on middle and leg, Mushy turns it away through midwicket
goes down the track, but Nyumbu does not let him get under it, lovely use of flight. Shakib has to check his shot and defend
pins him back in his crease and Shakib blocks
worked away through square leg from off stump as he uses the angle from around the wicket to his advantage
shortish and outside off, Mushy goes back and cuts quite late to pick up a single to deep point
flighted on off stump, defended
slanted in on middle and leg, Mushy rolls his wrists on the ball and finds short midwicket
lovely stroke from the captain as he wanders down the track, makes room for himself and hits inside out over where mid-off might have been
backs away and cuts a flatter ball from middle and leg into the covers
huge shout from the keeper as Shakib looked to chop a quick, short ball outside off. Although it was a brilliant take with him needing to stay low, there was no edge
whipped down to long-on. Kamungozi isn't really getting much turn
stays back and slaps a short delivery outside off to deep cover
dropped, by the captain as well. This was tossed up on off stump and lured the lazy drive. Came straight at him at short cover and it popped straight out
worked away off his pads to square leg
flighted on middle and off, Mushy lunged forward to tickle it fine but the ball rips past him and into the keeper's gloves down the leg side
nudged away through square leg to bring up the fifty partnership
runs at the bowler and hammers a drive down to the long-off boundary. Pure power from Shakib beats a desperate dive from the fielder down there. Got a hand to it, but only parried it away
goes down the track again, but this time Shakib is happy to work it away towards midwicket and retain strike
pushed through on off stump and Shakib blocks
"No, no, no, no," is heard as Shakib tucks a fuller deliveyr away to midwicket and has to go back to his crease
fifty for Shakib and Chittagong is up on his feet. So is the home dressing room. A push down to long-off gets him to the mark, and it's come in pretty good times as well
stays back to try and sneak a single through square leg, but Mushy has hit it a little too softly
worked away in front of square leg for a single
comes down the track and swats a length ball through to long-off for a couple. Shakib is becoming increasingly comfortable with this pitch
starts off with a shortish ball outside off and Mushy works it away with the turn through midwicket
turn! And enough to square up Shakib! It was pitched on a good length as he goes around the wicket and snares a leading edge down the pitch
when orthodoxy doesn't work.... Shakib walks acorss on off stump, but doesn't go too far that he exposes his stumps. Then plays a scoop for a  couple to deep fine leg
and another from Shakib as he stays low, keeps his eyes on the ball, which is flat enough to enable the scoop to go even finer
nips down the track to the pitch of a good length ball and whips it away to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Mushy blocks and then walks away to get himself some drinks
tossed up outside off, Shakin drives to long-off
flighted on off stump, pushed towards extra cover. Raza does well scurrying to his right from short cover
opts for a reverse sweep, but Mushy isn't able to get bat on ball, which was on a length outside off
slices it to point and races off to the other end
flatter and quicker, Mushy can't do much except nudge it into the on side
width outside off, though it was given in hopes of defeating Shakib who had charged down the track. No such luck as the batsman take a single to long-off
nudged away behind square leg as Mushy waits for a length ball on middle to come to him
seems to want to run down the track again, but ends up yorking himself on middle stump. Raza's got an arm ball and that time it was perfect
goes for another one of those, but it ends up a low full toss that is hammered down to the sight screen. Simply done
shortish and sliding on rather quicker on Shakib as well, swiped away to deep square leg
in the slog and Mushy has launched it over the boundary at straight midwicket. It was there for the slog sweep and Mushy converted it with glee
flighted on middle, driven down to long-off
tossed up outside off, Mushy drives confidently to long-off
backs away to thump a flatter delivery on off stump, but he mistimes it back at the bowler. Shakib is itching to get down the track, but Kamungozi isn't allowing him to
worked away to midwicket, no single there
backs away and pushes a length ball through to long-off
good length ball on off stump and Mushy opens his face and picks up a single to point
short of a length and outside off, Mushy ponders a single after dropping it towards point. The fielder is too alert for such hopes
throws his bat at a short ball outside off and his beaten. It was there to be cut, but Mushy did not get across to set up the stroke
runs a shortish delivery to third man. Took advantage of the width on offer and Mushy opened the face ever so late to pick up a couple
back of a length on off stump, defended
tucked away off the stumps through square leg
fine leg is inside the circle and Shakib knew that. He walked across and tickles a length ball from middle and to the boundary. Brilliant stroke
drops it a little short and Mushy has punched it through to long-off

"catch," was the call, but Shakib has timed this whip too well. He had come down the track to help with the stroke and placed the ball just wide enough from short midwicket and has beaten long-on on his left as well
tossed up on middle, pushed to long-off
a little shortish and outside off, Mushy has tapped it to point with the open face. Ump calls it a no-ball for the bowler tickling the stumps at his end
It wasn't a free hit, but maybe no one told Mushy. He had loaded up for a slog sweep against a fuller ball outside off and launched it way into the crowd
fuller delivery on off stump, drilled to long-on
nips down the track and drives a flighted delivery down to long-off. These two have raised a hundred partnership, and the 14 runs off the over is the most expensive of the innings so far
swivels on a slower, short ball on middle and leg and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Mushy pushes an open face in line with the ball and gets a single to third man
banged in short, but Shakib is quite happy to take it on. It was quick and climbed up rather high on him as well, but he is able to control it well to deep square leg
another short ball, another pull shot from Shakib. But he was rather cramped for room and the ball lobs off his splice. There was a widish mid-on in place, but it fall short of him as he runs forward
sliding down leg and Chakabva does quite well to leap to his left and ensure that doesn't run away
good length ball on middle and off, steered to point
launches it away over midwicket as the bowler strays a bit too close to the stumps
full and sliding down leg, Mushy goes for a leg glance and misses. Legcutter goes wrong
full on off stump, Mushy is forward and whips it away to the right of mid-on. Lovely use of the wrists

upper cut from Shakib! Saw the ball dug in short, so much that he has to jump up off the ground and help it on its way to the third man boundary. This is now Bangladesh's highest fifth-wicket stand in ODIs
back of a length and it holds in the pitch as well. Shakib was looking to pull this too, but then decides better of it

full and a shade outside off, Shakib has waited just long enough before jamming an open face down on it and squeezing it between point and short third man. Both men race after it and Sibanda has caught his knee into the turf while sliding and isn't able to pull it back. Gets some attention from the physio, time for the magic spray as well. Replenishes his fluids and then gets back on the field
too short and Shakib swivels on his back foot to pull to deep square leg
chops a shortish delivery from a shade outside off into the covers
stays back and runs a shortish ball angled in at off stump to third man
turned away to fine leg, but doesn't hit the gap
short and wide, Shakib jumped after it and tapped int on top of the bounce to the cover boundary. Top shot from Shakib as the run-rate keeps rising
goes short on middle this time and Shakib pulls to deep square leg
worked away towards fine leg for a single and he retains strike
stays back and worked away through square leg
this isn't the one though. A little short and a little wide and Shakib checks his cut shot through point and jogs across
full and wide, Shakib slices it to short third man
full on off stump, Shakib drills it to extra cover
they've chucked their discipline out the window in the latter half of this innings. That's the 12th wide from Zimbabwe
short and wide, Shakib's eyes lit up but he cuts beneath the ball and is beaten
tossed up and outside off, Mushy drives into the covers
cramps him up for room on middle as Shakib clears his front leg and swipes to wide long-on
that's his fifty and Chittagong rise for Mushy as well. Looks up at the sky and pays his respects after jogging through for a single
tossed up on the pads, Shakib punches it down to long-on and moves to 99
runs at the bowler and lifts a flighted ball inside out over the covers. Didn't quite time it as he got under the ball a little too much

short and wide, easy put away for Shakib as he raises a sixth ODI ton, and his first in four years! The dressing room is up in applause, so is Chittagong. This has been a vital knock to guide Bangladesh through a middle overs wobble and then stepping up for them when acceleration was needed
came down the track to a length ball outside off and slapped it to long-off

scooooped it, but hasn't timed it well enough. That was very risky considering the bowler had almost yorked him. Kamungozi was at short fine leg, but he preferred to stay back and restrict the runs than go for a possible catch
banged in short and he stayed deep in his crease to pull to wide long-on
full on off stump, pushed down to mid-off
runs down the track and goes for a huuuuge heave-ho. Misses the line of the ball outside off completely
stays back to a length ball on off stump and runs it down to backward point

runs down the track and launches a flighted ball straight down long-on's throat! Strikes it at the bottom of the bat so there is no timing on the stroke, even if there had been plenty of intent. Roars of "Shakib, Shakib" follow him all the way through to the dressing room.
stays back and chops a length ball from the stumps to point
turn now! This was looped up a shade outside off and lured the batsman forward to poke and then beats him. Excellent control of flight, and he got some dip there as well
loads up for a sweep and gets his first runs in 50-over cricket

length is not what you bowl in the death, but as well as Mushy has struck this, he has picked out the man at deep midwicket, Solomon Mire. The umps have asked him to wait to check about the front foot and Chiggy has overstepped big time. No wicket then, and a free hit will be available as well. Captain, what have you done?
length ball on middle and leg, Mushy looks to swivel pull it past fine leg. Can't
full and sliding down leg, that's been a very regular sight in this innings from Zimbabwe. Sabbir misses, but Bangladesh do get a wide
fuller delivery on middle, defended
shortis and with enough room the batsman can pull away to deep midwicket and snag a couple of runs, even with a bit of a collision between Sabbir nd Chiggy
whipped away through straight midwicket
full and wide outside off, Sabbir launches it over extra cover. Seems to have got enough bat on that to beat the off side infield and the only man in the deep there is the sweeper. Gets a good couple
slower ball sliced to short third man as Sabbir stays back in his crease
starts a new spell with a short ball that allows Mushy to stay deep in his crease and pull to deep square leg
goes wide of the crease and presents a low full toss that Sabbir smashes over mid-off. But it had come off the bottom of the bat so long-on mops up
full and angled in on middle, defended
seeks the blockhole on middle and misses by a few inches. Sabbir shows off his bottom-hand strength and tonks the ball down the ground to the boundary
another wristy drill down the ground as Panyangara seeks to bowl a yorker on off stump. Again, misses his mark
Mushy was backing away and the bowler slid the ball well wide of off stump. Tried to skirt the tram line outside off that indicates the wide, but he strays
full and outside off, Mushy smashes it to long-off
that's 3000 ODI runs for Mushy as he turns a fuller ball behind square leg
back of a length and outside off, chopped away towards short third man. Chatara did well there with the offcutter

dropped by Taylor at point. This was short and wide, deserving of all the power Mushy put into the shot but he forgot the place it. Lucky for him, Zimbabwe have not been at their best in the field today
another slower ball on middle and leg, Sabbir had completed his slog into the leg side before the ball struck him in the gut
races down to try and loft the length ball over Chatara's head, but he misses the line completely
length ball outside off, might have been a change of pace again, Sabbir swings and misses, which prompts Mushy to come forward and have a chat with him

runs at the bowler, who drags the length short. But that doesn't bother Mushy too much because he had made room while coming down and takes advantage of the width on offer to slap a boundary to third man

fourth chance of the innings and Mushy finally falls! It was the slower ball, which he had looked to launch over long-off. Didn't get enough bat on it because of the length being so full and there being no width to free his arms. Still, he's played a very good hand for his team
he has some power! Its a fuller delivery a shade outside off, but Sabbir has cleared his front leg and slammed it away over extra cover
front-foot pull from Sabbir, but he hasn't got enough. Raza hurtles in from deep midwicket to try and convert the chance, but he isn't able to get under the ball before it bounces
fuller and slower outside off, Sabbir was looking to open the face and take a single to third man but is beaten
continues with the change of pace and the batsman's wild slogs aren't offering much success. This time it's an inside edge that dribbles to the keeper
horrid full toss down leg and the batsman is not able to connect with his swipe. That's another wide from Zimababwe
shortish on middle and leg, pulled away to deep square leg
banged in short and it's targeting the batsman's head. Mashrafe backs away to try and swat it. Misses
another slower ball on off stump, Mashrafe is able to drag it away to deep square leg
what. a. strike! He had run down the track, sized up a length ball and then sent it screaming over cow corner. One of the best shots of the day. Just the balance after using his feet was striking
he's duped by a slower delivery this time and the slog ends up a leg bye towards the keeper
slower ball on middle and leg, goes for a swipe across the line and misses
finds the yorker on off stump and the batsman can only squeeze it away to point
another pin-point yorker, so much that only the off bail leaps off it's perch with the one on leg stump staying put. Mashrafe was trying to squeeze it away through point but was too slow on it
fuller delivery outside off, pushed down to long-off to get off strike
full toss on middle and leg, Sabbir plants his front leg across and laps it to the right of a short fine leg fielder
fuller delivery on middle and leg, Sabbir has cleared his front leg and launches the ball over long-on. What a cameo!

aaagain! This was full and wide and Sabbir has creamed it over the covers with considerable power to set up Bangladesh's highest total in Chittagong. He has 44 runs off 25 balls on debut, take a bow Sabbir!

inn2.comm: back of a length on off stump, nudged towards midwicket
invites the drive, and perhaps whatever swing that might be on offer, as he bowls fuller and outside off. Masakadza drives to mid-off
back of a length and outside off as Masakadza shoulders arms
drilled back at the bowler as Hami M keeps to his crease against a shortish ball on off stump
rocks back and punches a shortish ball down to mid-off. Mashrafe, the Bangladesh captain, opens with a maiden
hmm, it's just that kind of day. This is a length ball that skitters well down the leg side. Mushy isn't able to duck across to it either
banged in short and Raza shuffles across to try and pull, doesn't connect and the umpire gets more exercise
leaps off his feet to block a shortish ball a shade outside off
goes for a cut against a short ball that didn't quite enough have as much room as he thought. Only gets the inside edge
back of a length and outside off, pushes to at it with a straight face. The batsman's reaction seems to suggest that might have kept low

short and wide outside off, Raza flays it over the slips and third man hustles forward and to his right to try and convert a chance that was always dying on him. Falls well short in the end, despite his five

persists with a short ball and Raza has camped on his back foot and pulled it as hard as he could. Didn't quite time it properly, nor did he bother to keep it down. There's no one in the deep at square leg though
back of a length on off stump, punched between mid-off and cover
whipped away off middle and leg, and a second run materialises as the square leg fielder, Mominul, fumbles as a result of the pressure applied by Raza. Amazing running
gets a shortish delivery to straighten on off stump and snare the outside edge of Raza, but he rode it for a single to deep point
another wide as Mashrafe seeks to bowl fuller and at the stumps. It just tails too far down
cracking shot! Lined up a short ball so very early and though it didn't quite have as much width as necessary, Hami M has powered it away in front of point. Top shot
another boundary as he stands up tall behind a shortish delivery outside off and pummels it through the covers. Pure power from Hami M
phew! He's just as strong off the front foot. Slower ball on off stump has been walloped back down the ground to the long-off boundary
good length ball on off stump, defended
lovely shot through the covers as he stands up tall behind a shortish delivery outside off. Didn't look to put too much into the shot, but the timing was top class

huuuuge appeal from Al-Amin as he finally bowls a fuller length and gets the ball to dart back in at Hami M. He had pressed forward to block, but was too slow on it. He was struck on the move and might have been struck outside the line of off stump
reverts to his shortish length and adds to his own woes with the line going down leg. Hami works it away to the fine leg boundary, possibly off his thighs
finds a good length outside off and it has been left well alone
the new ball sits up on this pitch and Al-Amin provides width as well. Hami M tucks into it as he cuts violently to the point boundary.
gets forward to a good length ball and runs it to third man to retain strike. So, no worries with the run-rate yet. It's about double what's required!
flighted on middle as Hami M lunges forward to block. Starts with an arm ball that hits him quite low on the front pad too, but it would have gone down leg
holds up in the pitch as Hami M looks to play against the turn and closes the face to pick up a single through midwicket. Ends up getting a leading edge to point
pushes forward and blocks a length ball down the pitch
flighted on off stump, Hami M drives to long-off
tossed up on middle and leg, tucked away to short fine leg where Al-Amin does well enough for Mushy's praise: "Good boy, Al-Amin"
tossed up outside off and Raza obliges with a drive to long-off
drilled to long-off as he stays inside the line against a flighted delivery on middle and leg
that's lovely bowling. He pulled the pace right off this delivery and dragged the length back as well. Hami M prodded forward and is beaten as he hangs his bat outside off
flighted outside off and smashed to long-off
fired in flatter on off stump, Raza stays back to ease it to point
that's the arm ball from Shakib and the batsman had no clue. Raza had pushed forward to play for the turn and almost presents a gap between bat and pad
rocks back to a short ball and cuts it from middle stump
puts that pesky front leg out of the way and punches a length ball down to long-off
tossed up at the stumps, kept out
it's keeping low! This was a good length ball on middle and off and Raza just about manages to bring his bat down in time
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed back at the bowler. Definite signs of dew now, by the way
stays inside the line of a good length ball on off stump and pushes into the covers
opens the face and slices a flatter delivery to point. That makes it only five runs off the last three overs.
flighted on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
flighted in on off stump, Raza plonks a defensive bat down on it

there it is! You cannot keep him out of the game as he dupes Raza in the flight and gets him out stumped! The batsman had wandered forward but Shakib had pulled his length back, and gave it a little extra rip to beat the prodding bat and topple an important wicket
flighted on middle and leg, kept out

good length ball on middle, Sibanda has trusted a sweep but has top-edged it into the hands of short fine leg! There was no conviction behind the stroke, he simply wanted to get off strike and had chosen the wrong ball to hit across the line. Two wickets in the over then for Shakib
flighted on off stump, driven down to long-off
goes back and punches a good length ball back at the bowler
he's pierced the gap in the off side again. Sunny bowls short and the batsman rocks back so quickly and laces it through point and short third man
a lot slower through the air as Hami M looks to tickle it to short fine leg. Has to settle for a leg bye
flighted on middle, Hami M pushes to mid-off
lunges as far forward as he could and sweeps at the man at deep square leg, who has forgotten about how the ball would turn away from him with a short line that
huge appeal for leg before, and the bowler is rather miffed. "Oh my goodness!" exclaims Mushy as he sees the replay. The only problem was the ball had hit outside off. Lots of gamesmanship out there
tossed up and outside off, pushed away through the covers
goes back to a good length ball that seems to come on with the arm. Punched back down the pitch
stays inside the line and drives a flighted ball through the covers
flighted on middle and leg, kept out
pushed forward to block a good length ball on off stump
gets down the track to block a flighted ball on middle and leg
turn for Sunny! It was pitched on a good length and had been angled in at the batsman. Taylor pushed forward to block again but can't do so
pushing in on middle and leg, Hami M lunges forward to block
all that pressure is making Zimbabwe play a few false strokes. This was on a good length and turning quite sharply away from Hami M's intended drive on the up
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
goes back to whip a flatter delivery away through midwicket. Can't do so. Arm ball again
that's a Hami M special. It's rather short and wide outside off and he jumps back to cut it quite late and send it to the third man boundary
flighted on off stump, Taylor leans forward and slices it through the covers
looks to slam a flighted delivery into the leg side, but mistimes it to mid-on
that's a biggiieeee! Part-timer has lobbed up a juicy full toss and Taylor has slogged it over the midwicker boundary. Murderous stroke
driven away through the covers. Mominul keeps asking for the towel from the umpire. Dew has started to get into play
good length ball on middle gets the batsman forward and take the outside edge. But Hami M plays with soft hands and is able to get the ball past the slip
good length ball on off stump, defended
pushed through on middle and leg, Taylor nudges it towards midwicket
angles it in on off stump and Taylor reaches as far forward as he could to block
eases through a diving short cover fielder and picks up a single to long-off
flighted on off stump and driven smartly to long-off
goes back to block a flatter delivery on middle and off
back of a length on middle and off, punched to mid-on
lovely strike from Hami M as he lines up a shortish ball outside off and guides it through the point off the back foot
wonders about a quick single as he keeps to his crease to block a good length ball on off stump. Point does not oblige

good length ball on off stump, Taylor blocks into the covers and sets off. The fielder goes for a throw, doesn't hit the stumps but he does hit the Taylor and the ball deflects away to the long-off boundary. That means it is five runs. It was not deliberate, just a bit of bad luck for Bangladesh
good length ball ducking back in at Hami M, who blocks well enough
shortish and outside off, slapped away in front of point
back of a length on middle and leg stump, nudged away into the midwicket region
back of a length and outside off, and the ball straightens a touch as well. Hami M is wary of it as he blocks with soft hands
shortish on middle, pushed towards mid-on... until short midwicket intervenes
top shot as Hami stays back and punches a shortish delivery through the covers
good length ball on middle, Hami M pushes back at the bowler who leaps across to his right from his followthrough and parries it to mid-on and creates enough doubt to prevent a single
drilled down the ground! Lots of bottom hand from Hami M as he manufactures a boundary by staying deep in his crease
good length ball a shade outside off, Taylor turns it away to the right of midwicket
shortish and sliding down, clipped away to deep square leg

that's the big one! The bowling change has worked as Hami M is declared leg before! Mahmudullah moved around the wicket, pitched on middle and gets the ball to turn enough to hit him in front of middle. That's plumb!
good length ball on off stump, and Mahmudullah is definitely getting the ball to turn. Defended
tossed up on middle and leg, whipped away to short midwicket, who misfields and allows a single
gives the ball a good old rubdown with the towel before bowling. Taylor goes back and clips a good length ball to deep fine leg.
back of a length and outside off, Taylor shuffles across and tucks it through square leg
shortish and outside off again from Rubel, neatly flicked through midwicket
shortish on off stump, defended
probes a fuller length as Taylor gets forward to block
that's a slower ball on off stump, Taylor had spotted it and tapped it with soft hands towards point. Chakabva is alive to a quick single
dug in again on off stump, the new batsman is more than comfortable keeping to his crease and turning it to midwicket
stays back to tick a good length that slides down leg. Turned away to short fine leg
flighted outside off, Chakabva squeezes it away to deep cover
shortish on middle, Taylor flicks it to deep square leg and raises Zimbabwe's hundred
goes back and clips it through square leg
flighted outside off, brings himself forward to block
turns away a flighted delivery off his pads to deep square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, Taylor blocks and runs into the covers. Brilliant work from the two Zimbabwe batsmen
good length ball just outside off, punched to short cover
back of a length on off stump, Chakabva rolls his wrists on top of the ball and sends it to mid-on
banged in short and the ump says there was a little too much height on that. And he is quite right
that's deftly done as Rubel goes short and outside off. Chakabva waits on it and brings down an angled bat for a single to third man
shortish and outside off, Taylor is not able to connect properly with his slice. Gets only an inside edge. The excitable Chakabva was racing down for a single and is denied
good length ball slid down the leg side. Chalk up another wide in Chittagong
fuller delivery outside off, Taylor drills it into the covers to retain strike
tossed up on middle and leg, Taylor presses forward to block
looped up on off stump and it has been whipped away through midwicket
goes back and tucks a shortish delivery away to short fine leg
tossed up outside off as Taylor presses forward to block
pushes it through flat and outside off, Taylor shuffles across to block.

pushed through outside off, he might have paused before delivering that ball as well, but it doesn't bother Taylor as he goes for a reverse sweep. The bat comes down on the ball, the wrists roll on top of it and away it scurries
flighted outside off, Chakabva leans forward and drives through the covers
nips down the track to reach the pitch and then lifts the ball over mid-on. All he needed to do was place that ball after his footwork did most of the work for that shot
flighted and angled in on off stump, defended
flighted on off stump, defended
gets down the track to a good length ball that is tucked away into the midwicket region, and these two have been doing amazing work with their unning between the wickets

almost a chance as short cover dives forward, but it falls short! Opts for a forceful push into the covers and then decides to check his shot as Sunny gets a good length ball to hold in the pitch a little longer
goes back and clips a shortish ball off his pads to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, Chakabva punches it back at the bowler and the dew on the ball is enough to burst through his fingers
good length ball grips into the pitch and turns quite sharply, beats Taylor on his tentative forward defensive
tossed up on off stump, Taylor turns it away to midwicket

huge turn again for Mahmudullah and he thinks he has Taylor leg-before. It was pitched on a good length, ripped in to beat the defensive push quite easily and hit Taylor on his thigh in front of off stump, but that would have missed
tossed up outside off and pushed down to long-on
good length ball on the pads, tucked away through square leg
a little turn away from the bat, but Taylor overestimates it. Might be a result of that last over against Mahmudullah. Gets an inside edge on his intended push through the covers
pushed through on middle and leg and beats Taylor's flick to hit him on the pads, held it's line though and might not have hit the stumps
goes back and punches a shortish ball through the covers
flighted on off stump, safely defended
goes back and blocks a good length ball outside off
length ball on middle and off, swept away to deep fine leg
that stayed low! Chakabva is very lucky to be there. It was fired in flatter on middle and off, and Chakabva's hard hands just about made it down in time

not this time! He's made Chakabva play all around a tossed up delivery. He was lunging forward and turned a relatively harmless delivery into a yorker and then played across the line to have his stumps rearranged
goes back to punch a good length ball back at the bowler, who had to run across to his right. Mahmudullah is back over the wicket
stays back to whip a shortish delivery with the turn to deep midwicket
comes down the track and flicks a length ball through square leg
fired in on middle, Taylor keeps it out

tossed up outside off, Taylor looks to tap it on the off side and pick up a quick single. "Keeper!" was the shout, but Mominul sends down a wild throw after running to his right from point. Might have been a chance missed there
tossed up on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
looks to swipe a good length ball towards fine leg, but he was into the shot too early and the ball hits the back of the pad to get a single through the keeper's legs
flighted on off stump, whipped away to long-on
goes back and turns a shortish delivery off his pads to short fine leg. Mahmudullah has returned to bowling around the wicket
nudged to short fine leg again, but there are no runs on offer
a little shortish on leg stump, Taylor got inside the line and half-swept, half-pulled it away to the fine leg boundary. That's his first fifty on the tour, 30th overall
good length ball on middle, Taylor works it to short midwicket
there's no slip and a thick outside edge off a cut shot from Chiggy flies away past short third man
pushed through on the pads, nudged away to square leg. Taylor was certain there was a single and was halfway down, but Chiggy barely bothered
goes back and punches a flatter ball to mid-off
low full toss on leg stump, pushed down to long-on. Read dew
cracks this away behind point, but there is a sweeper in place though. Sabbir seems to be of the quicker, flatter variety of legspinners. So Chiggy plays him like a medium pacer
goes back and punches a shortish ball back at the bowler
flighted outside off as Mahmudullah bowls over the wicket. Defended

was that a drop? It seems to be. Mahmudullah is on his haunches as Arafar Sunny is not able to convert a chance at deep fine leg. Taylor goes for a sweep to a length ball on leg stump and top edges it. It would have been a good grab, with the fielder running forward and to his left. Had to dive as well, but it doesn't stick
goes back and tucks it through midwicket
dew or not, Mahmudullah is getting the ball to turn quite sharply. Chiggy was looking to back away and cut, but the good length ball pitches and rips in at him to make him check his stroke
pushed down to long-on
goes back and pushes through midwicket off a nearly straight bat to pick up a couple
fuller and outside off, Chiggy drives past the bowler's left to mid-off
blocks a fuller delivery on middle
shortish on off stump, punched back down the ground to long-on

ooooh, you little beauty! Mushy has pulled off a stunner to get rid of Taylor! This was an offcutter that held in the pitch and leaped up a little more than the batsman expected. He tried to run it down, but gets it a little too fine. Mushfiqur had stepped to his left, then flung himself to his right to grab a ball that had almost gone behind him!
good length ball, rather wide outside off. Pushed into the covers
full on off stump, driven down to mid-off
good length ball that drew the batsman forward and beat him for lack of turn. He's been giving the ball a good rip, but that time he shows off a bit of natural variation
stays back and punches a shortish ball to long-on
good length outside off, blocked
pushes a good length ball down to long-on
flighted and going on with the angle from around the wicket, Chiggy slices it behind point. Another single pinched
pushes forward to block a flighted delivery on off stump
fuller delivery outside off, Chiggy brings down an angled bat and tries to push it into the covers
back of a length and around the off stump, Chiggy goes for the cut with the required rate rising and gets an inside edge. Misses the off stump by just a few inches
fuller delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off
fuller delivery on off stump, driven to long-on
opens the face and slices a shortish ball off the stumps through point
driven into the covers for a single as he goes back in his crease and shows off a nice high elbow
tossed up outside off and the ball keeps going straight. Chiggy was looking to drive through the covers is beaten as he plays inside the line
punched down to mid-on
goes back and whips a shortish delivery over midwicket to the man in the deep
flighted on off stump, Mire stays put and opens the face to find short third man
"one's skidding, one's spinning, boys," says Mushy as this length ball is punched back down the pitch

hit straight to short cover and captain gets captain! It was a slower ball again, this one full enough to invite the drive and Chiggy doesn't keep it down. Zimbabwe are sinking, and Bangladesh are well on their way to their first win in 2014. Good time for drinks, no?
good length ball on off stump brings him forward to defend
uses an angled blade to slice a shortish delivery outside off to point
drags it short and Panyangara is able to pull through midwicket
that has been dispatched! That massively bottom-handed grip comes into play as he picks up a length ball and pummels it over cow corner
pulls the pace off a fuller delivery outside off and has Mire groping and missing
another sweep from another Zimbabwe batsman as he gets under the ball a bit too much. However, the deep square leg fielder is far enough back that there was no threat
backs away and cuts a shortish delivery outside off to deep point
flighted outside off and Mire reaches it on the full and smokes it through the covers. Rubel hoped to kick it away, but he isn't too successful. Four gifted away
stays back to a length ball and tries to flick it away. Keeps rather low and strikes him on the pad. Big appeal, but it would have slid down
short and sliding down again, Panyangara goes back and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, Mire slog sweeps to deep midwicket to end Mahmudullah's quota today. Two wickets and some alarming turn on occasion, he's had a good day
flighted outside off, eased towards point
flighted on off stump, defended
pushed through on middle, kept out by Mire

that's three for Shakib as he breaks through Mire's defences. Not that he offered much with a slog sweep across the line of an arm ball. Too full for that shot, not enough room either and Zimbabwe are heading towards a tame end as Chittagong rejoices
tossed up on the pads and Nyumbu has whipped it away to deep square leg
pushes forward and blocks a good length ball on off stump
flighted in on off stump and stays rather low too. Defended

another Zimbabwe batsman perishes to the sweep. It seems to be a go to shot, but they are not picking the balls. It was quick, flat and full. Didn't allow him to time for the stroke and he has to walk back
another arm ball, that the tail-ender tentatively came forward to bloc and wears it on the pads. Would have gone down leg
he goes forward to pushes a good length ball into the covers
sneaks in an arm ball on off stump and it barely misses the off stump. Chatara was going back to try for a late cut and misses
tossed up on middle, defended
drives down to long-off for a single
awful shot across the line to a fuller ball on middle and leg. He escapes only because the ball would have slid down
goes for a slog sweep as he sees the midwicket region vacant, misses though
flighted a shade outside off and it turns quite sharply to beat the outside edge
this is length and Chatara has smashed it down the ground to tuck into a consolation boundary.
flighted on off stump, defended
stays back to a length ball outside off and was looking to tuck it through midwicket. But it grips and turns right across him. Opens him up like a can 'o beans
again! Another good length ball on off stump brings the batsman forward to block but the turn beats him all ends up
pushed down to long-off
flighted on off stump, defended
a little short and wide and Chatara has tapped it wonderfully well. Played it as late as he could and secures three runs
tossed up on off stump, Nyumbu was looking to drive through long-off but gets an inside edge
flighted on middle and leg, defended
short and outside off, chopped away into the point region. Shakib isn't too pleased with the single
looped up on off stump and it was slow enough to tempt Nyumbu into a slog. beaten

taken at slip, which means he is the 12th player in history to hit a ton and claim four or more wickets in the same ODI. It was full and pushed through on off stump, the drive he was hoping to entice came through and there was just enough turn for outside edge, which was safely snapped up
pushed through full on off stump, drilled into the covers
good length ball on off stump, defended
good length ball on off stump, Chatara blocks off the back foot
tossed up on middle and Chatara is forward to block
keeps out a fuller ball on middle and leg
defends a flighted delivery outside off
tossed up on off stump, nudged to mid-off
goes back to chop a flatter delivery on off stump to third man for a couple
flighted on middle, kept out
this is short and he backs away to cut to short cover
oh dear, that was close! It was slower through the air and the batsman had lunged forward to block. It takes the outside edge and squirts away past silly point
mid-off was not deep enough to pose a threat to this. Ran back as much as he could and he dived too, but Kamungozi's trek down the track gives him four runs
this is short and Kamungozi rocks back and cuts through the covers

a hat-trick of fours for Kamungozi! This was fuller and outside off, he goes down on one knee and nails a square drive to the point boundary. So no five-for for Shakib, still a ton and four wickets is better than most
one ball after Shakib's spell is done, Sunny cleans up Chatara to record Bangladesh's first win of 2014. It was a skidder, pitching on a good length and ripping through his defences.
